item.title: Overgrown bushes blocking footpath, 16th September
item.description:
Greenwich Council is responsible for this stretch of land and have not come to cut the bushes for several years i reported to them last year and this year and still nobody has been around to cut the bushes it is blocking the pavement

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Newmarsh Road, Thamesmead, London

item.title: Blocked pavement on a busy street approaching 2 schools, 16th September
item.description:
No tiles and pavement had been dug up since early July 2025. Right of way completely blocked for months and some clever people parking not helping. This is a street on approach to 2 busy schools with some 900 pupils and lots of the families with small children forced to make their way on the road with 0 visibility because of the trees and parked cars.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 89, South Hill Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Misused rubbish bin- danger to drivers, 16th September
item.description:
This rubbish bin is daily used for domestic rubbish. Wind often takes debris and bags to the middle of the road and it is an accident waiting to happen. I have already witnessed a motorist and a cyclist falling trying to avoid the debris. The solution is to remove the bin or to apply existing legislation and fine the recurring offenders.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, West Eaton Place, Belgravia, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very large overgrown oak tree with branches overhanging into the road. It's not been pruned for approximately 5 or 6 years., 16th September
item.description:
This could be very dangerous in high winds. A nearby tree similar to this was blown down onto the road a while ago in high winds. Smaller branches and leaves and acorns are continuosly falling onto the pavement, road and neighbouring gardens. It needs pruning and the roads need cleaning. With regular use of the road by school students it could cause an accident if a large branch fell on to one of them.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Danson Crescent, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Junction between Murray street, Agar Grove and St Augustine's roads, 16th September
item.description:
Once again, I have to report this issue as the council seems to have dismissed all my prior efforts to raise this. The street lights around the new Agar Grove bridge are still not working despite the bridge works having been completed more than 2 months ago now! We are in contact with BAM who did the bridge replacement work and they stated that Camden Council is responsible for installing the arms and lanterns to the new lighting columns. This has not happened for more than 2 months now since the bridge works were completed, and is an excessive delay. BAM has left-over metal fences with temporary lighting on as a safety measure due to lack of proper street lights in the area. As a result, the area around the new bridge still looks like a construction cite because of the council's delay to install the arms and lanterns, which precludes the reinstating of proper street lights in the area. BAM is clear that this is the council's responsibility but the whole matter seems to have stalled. Could the council please take care of this issue. Please install the lamps and lanterns and re-instate the area's street lights so that the metal fences left-over by BAM can finally be removed and the area will cease to look like a construction site. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St. Augustine's Road, Kentish Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing Coach Ban Sign, 16th September
item.description:
The street is within a coach ban area and the sign has been removed. This is resulting in coaches driving down the street and into surrounding streets and becoming stuck.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wilton Terrace, Belgravia, London
Report on FixMyStreet
